intro: Michelia timorensis, commonly known as the Timor michelia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the family Monimiaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, round fruits that are edible. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
